Exam Frequency: Twice a year (Session 1 in January, Session 2 in April)
Mode of Exam: Online (Computer-Based Test); Drawing section for Paper 2A offline

Number of Questions.Paper 1: 75 questions (Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics; 25 per subject: 20 MCQ, 5 Numerical)

Marking Scheme: +4 for correct, -1 for incorrect (MCQ); No negative for Numerical
Participating Institutes: All NITs, IIITs, GFTIs, many private & state universities

Significance.Gateway to JEE Advanced 2026: Only the top 2,50,000 rank holders (across all categories) based on percentile cutoffs are shortlisted for JEE Advanced.
Significance.Direct Admissions: Admissions through JoSAA (Joint Seat Allocation Authority) counselling for NITs, IIITs, and GFTIs are purely merit-based, derived from JEE Main ranks.
Significance.Expanded Opportunities: Scores are also accepted by select state-level universities and private institutions, such as SRM Institute, Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham, and others.
Significance.Career Impact: Performing well can lead to early career exposure, internship opportunities, and industry recognition due to the reputation associated with JEE-qualified students.
Significance.Global Benchmark: NTA's adaptive testing, secure exam conduct, and international recognition make JEE Main one of the world's most respected undergraduate engineering assessments.

About / Overview: JEE Main 2026 (Joint Entrance Examination – Main) is India's largest national-level engineering entrance test conducted by the National Testing Agency (NTA). It is the entry gateway for admission to 31 National Institutes of Technology (NITs), 25+ Indian Institutes of Information Technology (IIITs), 35+ Government Funded Technical Institutes (GFTIs), and several reputed state and private universities. The exam also acts as a qualifying test for JEE Advanced 2026, which leads to admission in the IITs. The examination is held twice a year – Session 1 (January 2026) and Session 2 (April 2026). Each year, nearly 13–15 lakh candidates register to compete for around 40,000 seats in top technical colleges across India. Only the top 2,50,000 rank holders (across all categories) based on percentile cutoffs are shortlisted for JEE Advanced. Admissions through JoSAA (Joint Seat Allocation Authority) counselling for NITs, IIITs, and GFTIs are purely merit-based, derived from JEE Main ranks. Scores are also accepted by select state-level universities and private institutions. NTA uses normalization formula to account for variations in difficulty across shifts, with final ranking considering the best of two session scores. The exam is conducted using an advanced digital platform ensuring secure delivery, AI-backed proctoring, and objective evaluation.

Eligibility Criteria.For NITs/IIITs/GFTIs: Min 75% or top 20 percentile in board

Documents Required: Photo (80% face, white background, JPG/JPEG, 10–300 kb)

Exam Structure.Language Options: 13 — English, Hindi, Assamese, Bengali, Gujarati, Kannada, Malayalam, Marathi, Odia, Punjabi, Tamil, Telugu, Urdu
Exam Structure.Marking Scheme: +4 for correct answer, –1 for wrong, 0 for unattempted
Exam Structure.Medium: Online only (except Paper 2A Drawing section, conducted offline)

Exam Pattern.Paper 1: 75 Questions, 300 Marks, +4/-1 for MCQs, +4/0 for Numerical

Admit Card Details: Download from NTA portal; mandatory for entry; includes centre, date, slot, and instructions.
Answer Key / Response Sheet: Provisional, then final after objections. Response sheet downloadable.
Result & Score Calculation: Separate per session; best considered; percentile normalization for AIR; top 2.5 lakh for JEE Advanced.

Normalization & Scoring Process.Normalization Formula: NTA uses normalization formula to account for variations in difficulty across shifts
Normalization & Scoring Process.Percentile Calculation: Total Percentile Score = (100 × No. of candidates | marks ≤ your marks) / Total candidates in session
Normalization & Scoring Process.Final Ranking: Considers the best of two session scores (if appeared in both)
Normalization & Scoring Process.Relative Performance: Normalized percentile is based on relative performance, not raw marks

Counselling Process.JoSAA: Six online rounds; includes registration, seat allotment, verification, payment, and withdrawal options.
Counselling Process.CSAB: Special rounds for leftover seats in NIT+ system.

Career & Placement Opportunities.Top Recruiters: Google, Amazon, Microsoft, Adobe, Deloitte, and Infosys
Career & Placement Opportunities.Average Salary Range: ₹10–18 LPA for CSE; ₹6–12 LPA for Core branches

Preparation Tips / Books: Use HC Verma, IE Irodov (Physics); O.P. Tandon, JD Lee (Chemistry); RD Sharma, SL Loney, Amit Agarwal (Math)
Changes / Highlights (2026): Two sessions per year, best score considered
Paid edit window; strict document specs
Updated syllabus with focus on practical applications
Enhanced security measures for exam conduct

FAQs.A: Percentile; AIR based on normalized score

Conducting Authority.Name: National Testing Agency (NTA)
Conducting Authority.Role: Conducts the exam using an advanced digital platform ensuring secure delivery, AI-backed proctoring, and objective evaluation.
Functions: Formulates question papers ensuring balanced difficulty.
Implements normalization methodology for multi-shift exams.
Manages application, admit cards, results, and counselling coordination.
